elements.name: overallRating
question1
elements.html:
I had to talk them through - Able to perform some tasks but requires repeated directions

I needed to prompt - Demonstrates some independence, but requires intermittent prompting

I needed to be there just in case - Mostly independent, but still requires supervision for safe practice

I didn't need to be there - Understands risks and performs safely, ready for independent practice

elements.title: OVERALL RATING
elements.description: Supervisor/Trainer observes the trainee performing the procedure and indicates which describes the competence of the trainee in the scenario observed

elements.name: question3
elements.html: Supervisor/Trainer uses the prompts below to provide comments on the trainee’s performance in at least 3 areas.

elements.name: preoperativePreparation
elements.title: Preoperative Preparation
elements.description: Obtains/confirms informed consent from the patient, prepares for procedure according to agreed protocol, checks patient’s record, ensures equipment is available, participates in timeout, correctly prepares and positions patient.

elements.name: proceduralSteps
elements.title: Procedural Steps and Anatomy
elements.description: Demonstrates familiarity with the sequence of the procedure and anatomical exposure and the structures encountered; targets the approach appropriately

elements.name: manualDexterity
elements.title: Manual Dexterity and Flow
elements.description: Demonstrates safe effective and efficient use of instruments; safe and effective tissue handling; efficient anastomotic technique, endarterectomy technique, etc; demonstrates economy of movement and efficient procedure flow; pre-empts requirements for equipment.

elements.name: situationalAwareness
elements.title: Situational Awareness and Adaptability
elements.description: Anticipates complications and takes appropriate precautions to minimise harm; adapts procedure to patient specific anatomy and pathology, responds to unexpected circumstances.

elements.name: communication
elements.title: Communication, Professionalism and Leadership
elements.description: Respectful and effective communication with staff; seeks assistance when appropriate; remains calm and in control in high pressure situations.

elements.name: postoperative
elements.title: Postoperative
elements.description: Provides instructions for postoperative care; documents details of the procedure.

elements.name: generalComments
elements.title: General Comments on what was done well or what could be improved

choices.text: Trainee should repeat this activity on a similar case
